0.text: The process starts with preparing a summary of content.  This is followed by an inclusive gateway, after which the process can take one or more paths. The content summary can be emailed to subscribers and posted on related forums and groups.  After emailing subscribers, there is another inclusive gateway. Following this gateway, the process can comment on related blog posts and/or deep-link to the content from older posts. Commenting on related blog posts leads to another inclusive gateway, where the process may take one or more of the following paths: post on Q&A sites, submit to link roundups, and reverse engineer your competition.  Each of these tasks then flows to an inclusive gateway.  Deep-linking to content also connects to that same inclusive gateway. Another inclusive gateway follows before joining with the path of posting on related forums and groups into a final inclusive gateway. The process ends after this gateway.

tasks.name: Deep-link to content from older posts
Post on related forums and groups

1.text: The process starts with preparing a summary of your content.  This is followed by an inclusive gateway, after which you can email your subscribers and/or post on related forums and groups. After emailing subscribers, there is another inclusive gateway, after which you can comment on related blog posts and/or deep-link to the content from older posts. After commenting on blog posts, there is an inclusive gateway after which you can post on Q&A sites, and/or submit to link roundups, and/or reverse engineer your competition.  After posting on Q&A sites, there is an inclusive gateway. After submitting to link roundups there is another inclusive gateway leading to the same point as the previous gateway.  After reverse engineering your competition there is yet another inclusive gateway that leads to the same point as the two previous gateways. These three gateways converge in one further inclusive gateway. After deep-linking to content from older posts, there is an inclusive gateway leading to the same place as the previous gateway. These two gateways also converge to a further inclusive gateway. After posting on related forums and groups, there is a final inclusive gateway leading to the same point as the previous gateway. These final two gateways converge and the process ends.

This is followed by two parallel paths: one where the credit department receives the application, and another where the borrower completes the loan application. Once both actions are completed, they are synchronized.  Next, the process checks for completeness and simultaneously sends the application back to the applicant. These two parallel paths are also synchronized. Subsequently, the underwriting process begins, and concurrently, the credit score and risk score are checked. After these two checks, the process synchronizes again and proceeds with either loan application approval or a reduction in the loan amount. These two outcomes are synchronized, after which the loan funds are received. Finally, the process ends.

1.text: The process starts and the first step is to send the documents to the senior accountant in the department.  Next, a receiving report is created. Then, the process splits, with one path leading to reporting errors to the relevant team member, while the other path leads to confirming all documents have been amended. If errors were reported, the process waits until all documents have been amended. If the documents were confirmed amended, then a three-way match is double checked. After any errors are reported and fixed or if no errors and the match is checked, the process merges. Next, it splits again; one path is to store the documents in the paid invoice file, while the other is to create a voucher for the documents. If the documents are stored, they are then entered into the accounts payable account and stamped.  If a voucher was created, the process waits until the other path completes the storing, entry, and stamping.  After the invoice is entered and the documents are stamped, the two paths merge. Finally the voucher process and documents process merge and the process ends.

The process merges again after both parallel paths are complete. After the merge, the process splits into three parallel paths: record your activity digitally, establish monthly contact with your client, and make a second physical copy. 0.text: The process starts with a check of the ticket type.  This check is followed by a parallel split where the ticket type is determined as either a 'Simple Question', a 'Technical Issue', or it is further classified to be a 'Billing Question'. After determining the ticket to be either a simple question or a billing question, these paths are synchronized, and then split again in parallel to test any technical issues and to respond to the ticket question. The response to the ticket question is followed by an inclusive gateway, meaning either one or both of the following paths will be taken: the inclusive gateway leads to replicating the issue, or to the next step directly. If the issue is replicated, the process continues to synchronize with the test of technical issues. Both the test of technical issues and the follow-up to the ticket response converge in a parallel join, which leads to the end of the process.

The synchronized flow then splits into parallel paths to test technical issues and respond to the ticket question. After responding to the ticket question, it is checked if the issue needs to be replicated.  If so, the issue is replicated.  The 'replicate issue' path and the 'respond ticket question' path are then synchronized.  The synchronized flow joins with the 'test technical issues' path, and finally, the process ends.

Finally, after testing technical issues and completing the previous inclusive gateway, the paths synchronize at a parallel gateway. The process then ends.

One path involves sending a credit application form to the buyer, followed by getting approval for a post-credit check review. Finally, after both sales records are completed, the process ends.

This is followed by parallel paths: analyzing how they use your product, determining ways to increase value, and identifying key points of value.  Analyzing how they use the product leads to quantifying the impact of cancellation.  The three parallel paths converge, leading to another set of parallel paths: confirming the call date and time, and giving them a call.  Confirming the call date and time goes into an inclusive gateway checking for customer response, leading to recording whether or not the customer responded and recording if they are willing to talk.  Recording if the customer responded leads to sending them an email. Both sending the email and recording if they are willing to talk converge at another inclusive gateway. Giving the customer a call also converges at this same inclusive gateway.  After this gateway, there are parallel paths for giving them a call and an inclusive gateway branching to summarizing why they want to leave and asking open-ended questions.  Both of these converge into another inclusive gateway.  This leads to parallel execution of describing your ideas to increase value, presenting them with a special offer, and informing them of key metrics demonstrating value.  These three paths converge at an inclusive gateway that then flows to thanking them for their time and feedback, and recording the customer's decision. These two paths converge at a final inclusive gateway, leading to asking if they have any other concerns. Finally, noting down important learnings from the conversation concludes the process.

The process ends after these parallel paths complete.

Then, the process forks into two parallel paths: one where the borrower completes the loan application, and another where the credit department receives the application. These paths converge when both tasks are completed.  Next, the process proceeds to an inclusive gateway, from which it can take one or both of the following paths: sending the application back to the applicant and/or giving written notice to the applicant.  These paths converge at another inclusive gateway. 0.text: The process starts with confirming the basic information.  This is followed by two parallel paths: confirming if the process requires optimization and identifying the process's components. Once both paths are complete, the process proceeds based on whether certain conditions are met.  If so, the next step is to assess if any steps are confusing and also consider where bottlenecks occur.  These two paths proceed in parallel and are followed by defining how long it takes to complete the process and looking to see if the process can be simplified, also executed in parallel.  Concurrently with those steps is an additional step: examine potentially wasteful steps.  These three parallel paths converge and lead to writing the potential process improvements. Next, approval for processing improvements is obtained. This is followed by two parallel paths: defining what would make the improvements successful and choosing who will test the updated process. These two paths converge after the second path by choosing who will test the updated process which is then followed by updating the process documents and using the updated process, in parallel.  Once these are complete the process continues by defining what would make the improvements successful which eventually merges into one path which is followed by updating the process documents and using the updated process. After both paths are complete, the process continues with communicating the process changes and implementing the process changes, again in parallel. Finally, the process ends.

0.text: The process starts with recording basic details. Next, the impact of cancellation is quantified.  Then, the process splits into three parallel paths. In the first path, an email is sent to the customer, and whether or not the customer responded is recorded. In the second path, a call date and time is confirmed with the customer. Afterwards, they are given a call, and it is recorded if they are willing to talk or not. In the third path, the customer is given a call and if or not they are willing to talk is recorded.  The three parallel paths converge. The reason why the customer wants to leave is summarized. Next, ideas to increase value for the customer are described as well as key metrics demonstrating that value. The two parallel paths converge. Then it splits again into two paths. In the first, the customer is thanked for their time and feedback. In the second path the customer's decision is recorded. The two parallel paths converge. The customer is asked if they have any other concerns. Important learnings from the conversation are noted down, and the process ends.

1.text: The process starts with recording basic details. Next, the impact of cancellation is quantified.  Based on the impact quantification, one or more of the following actions take place concurrently: An email is sent to the customer, a call date and time is confirmed, and the customer is contacted via phone.  If an email was sent, it is then recorded whether or not the customer responded. If a call was made, it is recorded if they are willing to talk.  The information from email and call outcomes is gathered and the reason why the customer wants to leave is summarized. Based on this summary, one or more of the following actions can be taken concurrently: ideas to increase customer value are described, and the customer is informed of key metrics demonstrating this value.  If ideas for value increase were shared, or key value metrics were presented, or both, it proceeds to the next step. This step involves thanking the customer for their time and feedback, and simultaneously recording the customer’s decision.  Finally, any other concerns the customer might have are addressed, important learnings from the conversation are noted down, and the process ends.

tasks.name: Describe Ideas to Increase Customer Value
Inform Customer of Key Value Metrics
Thank Customer for Time and Feedback

2.text: The process starts with recording basic details. Next, the impact of cancellation is quantified. Based on this quantification, three paths can be followed concurrently: sending the customer an email, confirming a call date and time, or giving them a call. If an email is sent, the customer's response is recorded. If a call is made, it is recorded whether the customer is willing to talk.  The process continues when the customer’s response to the email, the confirmed call date and time, and whether or not they are willing to talk are all completed, at which point the reason for the customer wanting to leave is summarized. Following this, two parallel paths can be taken: describing ideas to increase value and informing the customer of key metrics demonstrating value. After both of these are completed, a decision is made whether to thank them for their time and feedback, or to record the customer’s decision. Both thanking and recording lead to the next step: ask if they have any other concerns, following which the conversation is concluded by noting down important learnings, which ends the process.

Once both paths complete, the loan funds are received by the borrower, and the process ends.

1.text: The process starts with providing the bank statement to the lender.  Next, the borrower completes the loan application. Then, the process forks into two parallel paths: one where written notice is given to the applicant, and another where the application is sent back to the applicant.  The path where the application is sent back rejoins the other path via inclusive gateways, where it may be joined by the results of a completeness check.  After these paths converge, they are again split into parallel paths where written notice is given to the applicant and where a completeness check is performed on the application, with those paths being joined and synced when these are finished. Then, the underwriting process begins and the credit score and risk score are checked in parallel, and then these results are also synced. After that, the loan amount is reduced and the interest rate is changed, with these results synced as well, and finally, the loan funds are received, which ends the process.

2.text: The process starts with providing the bank statement to the lender.  Then, the borrower completes the loan application.  These two actions occur sequentially. The path involving the written notice joins the converged inclusive gateway. Subsequently, both paths merge and execute two parallel processes: beginning the underwriting process and checking the credit score and risk score. These parallel processes then synchronize and proceed to another parallel gateway. After this, two parallel tasks are executed: reducing the loan amount and changing the interest rate. These two tasks synchronize, and finally, the loan funds are received, after which the process ends.

0.text: The process starts with confirming the basic information. Then, the process forks into two parallel paths. The first path assesses the performance of the process, and the second identifies the process's components. The second path continues to confirm if the process requires optimization.  Both paths converge, and then split again. The now rejoined process splits into two parallel paths, where one assesses if any steps are confusing, and the other notes which steps can be automated. The path to automate steps continues by splitting into another two parallel paths which define how long it takes to complete the process, and examine potentially wasteful steps. These paths rejoin and continue. Simultaneously, all parallel paths converge and then split once more. This starts a path which writes the potential process improvements and subsequently gets approval for processing improvements. The approved process then splits into two parallel paths, one using the updated process and the other determines what improvements should go forward. The paths converge and split again. This last parallel split will communicate the process changes and simultaneously schedule the next process review and optimization before finally converging and ending the process.

0.text: The process starts with entering results in the canvas gradebook.  This is followed by an inclusive gateway allowing for the parallel execution of importing the gradebook, selecting the exam assignment, and applying special grades to individuals.  After the gradebook is imported, grades are calculated. The calculated grades, the exam assignment selection and the special grades application all converge at an inclusive gateway. Next, the grades summary is reviewed.  Another inclusive gateway follows, enabling parallel paths for exporting the course summary and exporting the final grades.  After exporting the course summary, the grades are recalculated.  Both the recalculated grades and the exported final grades flow to a subsequent inclusive gateway.  Following this gateway, there is another inclusive gateway allowing for the parallel execution of getting approval signatures by the course director and submitting the results to SSO. After submitting the results to SSO, the examiner's grade approval sheet is sent.  Finally, the results from the approval signature step and the approval sheet converge on an inclusive gateway, after which the process ends.

0.text: The onboarding process starts with making an introduction to the new hire.  Next, the role, goals, and projects are discussed with the supervisor. Following the discussion, the process splits into two parallel paths. In the first path, training materials are assigned, then the new hire is taken out to lunch. After lunch, the process again forks into three parallel paths: a welcoming ceremony is held, expectations are explained, and the office is toured. After the ceremony, a mentor is assigned. Concurrently, after the expectations are explained, the new hire is inducted into the company culture. The assigning of a mentor, the office tour, and the company culture induction converge.  Meanwhile, after the training materials are assigned, this path synchronizes with the convergence point of the other actions (assigning mentor, office tour and company culture induction). Next, the first project is assigned.  Following the project assignment, the process splits again into three parallel paths: check-in meetings are planned, long-term goals are explained, and reading material for personal growth is provided. Concurrently, after planning the check-in meetings, the new hire is encouraged to socially interact with the team. Finally, all parallel paths converge: reviewing the onboarding process over the next 60 days, encouragement to socially interact, and explanation of the long-term goals, combined with providing reading material for personal growth - concluding the onboarding process.

Review onboarding process over the next 60 days

1.text: The process starts with learning how to identify future failures.  This is followed by three parallel paths: specifying product market share, checking the startup's location, and doing a SWOT analysis. The startup's location check leads to making plans for future products.  The market share, future product plans, and SWOT analysis converge. Based on the convergence of these three activities, the following are reviewed: number of employees, the business plan, and the company mission and direction.  Reviewing the number of employees leads to reviewing enthusiasm. Reviewing company mission and direction leads to a parallel review of trustworthiness and ability as a team leader. Trustworthiness feeds into the review of team chemistry, and team leader ability also feeds into the review of expertise. Both team chemistry and expertise converge and join with the team leader review.  Enthusiasm and business plan review, along with the combined review of team chemistry, expertise, and team leadership, converge. This leads to checking the exit strategy and cash flow. Both exit strategy and cash flow are reviewed, leading to analysis of competition's reputation and knowing the exact competition. Finally, these two converge, leading to checking trademarks, which concludes the process.

2.text: The process starts with learning how to identify future failures.  This is followed by a parallel split with three concurrent paths. The first path involves checking the specific product market share. The second path involves checking the location of the startup, followed by making plans for future products. The third path is doing the SWOT analysis. These three paths converge into a parallel gateway. The converging gateway leads to an inclusive gateway that triggers three concurrent paths. The first involves reviewing the number of employees, followed by reviewing enthusiasm. The second path reviews the business plan. The third path is reviewing the company mission and direction, followed by a parallel split to review trustworthiness and review ability as a team leader. The review of trustworthiness leads to an inclusive gateway, where it waits for the review of team chemistry and the review of expertise which are initiated from a converging gateway after reviewing the ability of being a team leader. This is then followed by a parallel gateway with three converging paths. The first path continues from reviewing enthusiasm to join this gateway via another inclusive gateway with the path coming from reviewing the business plan. The other two converging paths come from the previous inclusive gateway, now carrying the combined result of reviewing team chemistry and expertise, along with reviewing the ability as a team leader. The inclusive gateway leads to another inclusive gateway that triggers two paths: Check exit strategy and check cash flow. These two paths converge into an inclusive gateway, followed by a parallel split, with two concurrent paths: analyze the reputation of competition and know the exact competition. These converge into a parallel gateway, leading to checking trademarks. Finally, the process ends.

0.text: The process starts with entering purchase order details.  Next, a receiving report is created. Based on the receiving report, the process can branch into one, two, or all three of the following paths: A report of errors is sent to the relevant team member; the receiving report is gathered; and the vendor's invoice is gathered. If the vendor's invoice is gathered, a three-way match is conducted, and this may lead to either double checking the three-way match or confirming all documents have been amended. Both these paths converge and continue. Meanwhile the other two branches originating from the decision based on the receiving report also converge (reporting errors and gathering the receiving report). After this all four paths converge and execute in parallel the following three actions: stamping all documents; storing the documents in a paid invoice file; and checking dates to avoid penalty charges.  Stamping all documents is followed by creating a voucher for the documents.  Storing the documents in the paid invoice file leads to entering the invoice into the accounts payable account. Entering the invoice into the accounts payable account and scheduling the payment are then combined, which is also combined with creating a voucher for the documents, as well as checking the dates to avoid penalty charges. Finally, the process ends.

0.text: The process starts with recording basic details.  Next, the key points of value are identified.  Then, the process forks into two parallel paths: one where the call date and time are confirmed, and another where it is recorded if they are willing to talk.  These paths converge, and depending on whether either or both of the previous steps occurred, the process proceeds.  If either or both conditions are met, two parallel paths are initiated; one involves identifying the root cause(s) of the problem and the other involves asking open-ended questions.  These two paths converge again and are followed by presenting the customer with a special offer.  This leads to two more parallel paths, thanking them for their time and feedback, and recording the customer's decision.  After these paths converge, there is an inquiry into any other concerns the customer might have. Finally, the process forks one last time into parallel paths for sending learnings to appropriate managers and noting down important learnings from the conversation. The process ends after the two paths converge.

0.text: The process starts with recording the order details. Then, the process forks into two parallel paths. In the first path, it is checked that the products are in stock, and if so, a request is sent to procure the necessary products. In the second parallel path, products are retrieved from storage, their quality is assessed and subsequently recorded. Once both paths are complete, they converge.  Next, the process splits again into two parallel paths. One path involves packaging the items securely, while the other involves obtaining approval. After the approval is granted, this path splits again into three parallel paths: printing the packing slip, measuring products, and attaching the shipping label to the packaging, which in turn leads to printing the invoice. These three paths converge, and their completion is synchronized with the packaged items, after which they all converge together.  Finally, the items are loaded into the delivery vehicle, a confirmation email is sent to the customer, and the process ends.

1.text: The process starts with recording the order details.  Then, the process forks into two parallel paths. In one path, it checks that the products are in stock, and then requests the ordered products from inventory. In the other path, it records which products were taken from storage, and then performs quality checks. The two paths converge, and then based on some conditions packaging of the items, or obtaining approval, or both, take place. After approval, three tasks start in parallel: print packing slip, measure products, and attach shipping label to packaging. Attaching the shipping label leads to printing the invoice. The parallel tasks converge, after printing the invoice and packing slip and measuring products. Packaging items and the previous converged flow converge and leads to loading items into the delivery vehicle. Finally, a confirmation email is sent to the customer, after which the process ends.

Next, the potential process improvements are written, and approval for processing improvements is obtained.  The process again splits into two parallel paths. The first involves using the updated process. The second parallel path is to define what would make the improvements successful.  The paths converge and split again.  One path is to communicate the process changes, which is followed by implementing the process changes. The other parallel path is to schedule the next process review and optimization. These two paths converge, and the process ends.
